summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office staff and Bureau of Prisons staff regarding the replacement of a broken hard drive for Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center. Includes coordination on submitting a letter to Judge Nathan and returning the broken drive.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the correspondence; a replacement hard drive is being sent to her at the Metropolitan Detention Center after she broke her previous one.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The recipient of a letter being prepared by the U.S. Attorney's Office; the correspondence mentions fixing a track change before submission.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Multiple AUSAs from the Southern District of New York are involved in coordinating the drive replacement and communication with the court and BOP.

persons.name: Staff Attorney
persons.context: A Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons staff attorney at the Metropolitan Detention Center who is involved in the correspondence regarding Maxwell's drive.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.context: The intended recipient at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the return mailing of Maxwell's broken hard drive.

connections.description: The AUSA is part of the prosecution team handling Maxwell's case, coordinating logistical matters related to her detention and access to materials.
The BOP staff attorney is involved in facilitating access to the replacement drive for Maxwell at the detention center.
The AUSA is preparing and submitting a letter to Judge Nathan, who is presiding over Maxwell's case.

events.title: Replacement Drive Arranged
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office arranges to send a replacement hard drive for Ghislaine Maxwell via FedEx to the MDC, as she had broken her previous one.

events.title: Letter to Judge Nathan Prepared
events.description: Correspondence regarding finalizing and submitting a letter to Judge Nathan, with a request to fix a track change in the document.

locations: Southern District of New York, New York, NY 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, Brooklyn, New York 11232
U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell broke a hard drive while in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center, requiring a replacement to be sent.
The U.S. Attorney's Office was coordinating with the Bureau of Prisons to ensure Maxwell received the new drive and to have the broken one returned.
A letter was being prepared for submission to Judge Nathan, with a minor formatting issue (a track change) needing correction.
The correspondence highlights ongoing logistical and administrative aspects of Maxwell's pretrial detention and case management in December 2020.
